name: Divine spear of Kord (Bard 24 / RDD 14 / Cleric 2)
author: Aquarius 233

posts.author: Aquarius 233
posts.content:
Hello all!

I have thought about a bard meeler for my second PC to be played on WoG server, but it had to be a different one than the one played before (Bard26.Rdd10.Fighter4).
Well, maybe this toon's not so different but I have never seen the same class level split both into this new ECB and the former one, as they either had cleric as main class or had each classe below lv 20: this ruins the "undispellability" factor (from greater dispelling), which can be a real nuisance on WoG.
Due to the high Strenght, I chose as deity, in WoG, Kord.

Revision after revision, here is the current build, waiting for your advices and - after some playtesting, if in your opinion it can deserve - a place into the "Full lv 40" section:

Bard(24), Red Dragon Disciple(14), Cleric(2), Human

STR: 16 (40)
DEX: 8
CON: 14 (16)
WIS: 8
INT: 12 (14)
CHA: 16 (18)

This build is quite feat starved, and I struggled to take either the "divine" feats (and prerequisite) and the "minimum" combat feats. However, due to the high STR and bardic defenses (songs/haste/improved invisibility, either war cry when fighting multiple foes with low will save that can be subject to "fear"), I chose to rely on a 2-hand weapon, and such weapon can only be a spear to avoid taking proficiency feats.
Lasting inspirations allows for an higher use of debuffing song (ucurse song), as the uses needed to buff my pc are lower.
CHA is raised to 18, so by capping it (30) one can reach a "round" 10 divine damage/AC (in game calculations are easier with rounded numbers 😜).
Also, divine power and shield awork with CHA, so there is a synergy between cleric and bard classes. This is my preferred combination, as I can play good characters (instead, the other choice would be to switch to Blackguard, but that means one more feat as prerequisite and more room for levels, making it impossible for bard to reach undispellability - apart from Mords - and the RDD to obtain the bonus feat. Also, I find it really hard of playing evil characters).
If it is needed, one can choose to go "morningstar + shield" for more AC.
For meta-magic feats, as I would play it in WoG server the choice would be to replace still spell with craft wand.

Unbuffed AB is 42 that can be raised by 5 (greater magic weapon), 2 (war cry), 6 (bulls strenght+items), 7 (bard+curse song) = 62
Even without capped STR, at lv 40 AB can be raised for a long time to 42+5+7+2(maximum bulls strenght effect)= 56
Damage at lv 40 is 1d8+31 (with spear and capped STR) or 1d8+25 (morningstar), plus the temporary "war cry" effect (+2 damage) (hope that I have not lost something).

Builds with the same classes in the new ECB guild:
Universal Draco Priest by Empyre65 (bard 4 / cleric 26 / red dragon disciple 10, human)

Builds with the same classes in the old ECB guild:
(CLC 16/Bard 14/RDD 10): cleric 16 / bard 14 / red dragon disciple 10 (human?) by cdualepp
Scion of the Wyrm: bard 15 / cleric 15 / red dragon disciple 10 (human) by Cinnabar Din
Angelic Avenger: cleric 14 / bard 16 / red dragon disciple 10 (human?) by Diesel, Vin Diesel
WarPriest of the Dragonlords: cleric 22 / bard 8 / red dragon disciple 10 (human) by dmuzzy
Divine Spellsword: cleric 28 / bard 2 / red dragon disciple 10 (human) by dust7
Divine Dragon Herald: bard 16 / cleric 14 / red dragon disciple 10 (elf?) by Ithacan
Holy Dragon Song: cleric 19 / bard 11 / red dragon disciple 10 (human?) by Ithacan
Draconic Cleric: cleric 26 / bard 4 / red dragon disciple 10 (human) by Jennalee
draconic divine cleric: cleric 24 / bard 2 / red dragon disciple 14 (human?) by jjjhhhlll
Blood And Faith: bard 4 / cleric 26 / red dragon disciple 10 (human) by Mithdradates

Enough words from my side, let's hear yours! 😋

EDIT: build taken to lv 4. Struggled so much with a PC without expertise, this is my first time in WoG without relying on this feat and I had an hard time! I learned to use magic missile wands to defeat lesser mobs. Summons and "hit and run" tactics are a must on such low levels.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content: Will it help to swap feats and take the first cleric level early so you can wear full plate?

posts.author: ratty_uk2011
posts.content:
Not sure what the Cleric levels are bringing ; it's costing you an extra two feats and +12 items to get Chr to a level (30) where the DM and DS durations  are long enough to be useful.

And your Wis isn't high enough to cast spells.

Also all that Str but no Dev Crit seems a waste.

I'd be tempted to replace the Cleric Levels with Fighter which will give you two extra feats and Martial Weapons.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hello Aquarius233!

Great to see another build from you! Not only that, but you are trying to push the boundaries of what is possible!

Lots of things I like here. Great choices of feats. Lots of skill points. HP around 400+ to melee well. 40 Str with so many levels of bard is quite impressive. 

Spear I think is quite an underrated weapon. Use of the cleric domains of healing and animal synergise and buff the bardic spells available.

You've also found a way to utilise the so called divine might/shield 'cleric' cheese strategy into a build, something I have been striving to do for some time! And something that RattyUK2011 has just discovered (Divine Might cheese is why cleric is so low!)!.

And you've trawled through a pile of builds to make this so as far as I can see you've done your homework!

I think this character is going to be a great asset to any party, both as a tank, buffer (stuff like Bard song, Improved Invis, GMW, Bull's Str, Keen Weapon, Haste) and crippler so feel free to PM anytime you want to party up and we can go smash some areas together.

I have some small suggestions which I would implement, as a matter of personal preference, feel free to implement or discard as you wish
Spoiler Starting stats 02: Bard(2)

posts.author: ratty_uk2011
posts.content:
Ah, apologies if my reply seemed terse or dismissive - typing on phone.

Another reason to drop DS is that with a (comparatively) low Chr score, you'll only have maximum 13 (3 base + Chr modifier) uses of the Divine feats.   So saving them for unresistable DM damage makes sense.

posts.author: Aquarius 233
posts.content:
Okay I closed the web page before finishing the reply, and lost all I wrote. I'll try to be concise this time. But thank you for your observations, I really appreciate them!

@ Mick and Orion: I agree with you, the cleric levels are to be taken as early as possible, and I like the feat and level progression suggested by Orion! However, it seems that if I even want to level up for two levels as a cleric, I have to adhere to the server rules and take one of the available deities. Between Animal and Healing domains, Animal wins as it can truly help me levelling.
I will post a clarification request on WoG forums, so I can understand if rules for divine classes apply also to 1 cleric level.

@ rattyuk and Orion (remaining comments): I have already played with a bard26.fighter4.RDD10 in the WoG offline module, so I would want to avoid playing the same type of build so early (who knows what the future will bring). Moreover, creating something that has not been done before has truly encouraged me (as usually I am not so creative).
I understand that, even if without Weapon specialisation, the damage alone from strenght is sufficient.
For dev crit, I want to avoid it for both personal and pratical reasons: personal is that I truly dislike that feat, as it makes things boring (already tried it with a max scimitar crit range) and I don't want to transform such an exciting experience as WoG in a boring experience. Maybe one day I'll change my idea, but not now..... :)

I understand your point of view for divine feats, and I chose divine feats for more AC (even if, with the bard.fighter.RDD I managed to reach >74 AC), thinking that in a fight I would choose among one of them, and not both of them.
As I am RDD and bard, I would agree to replace Divine Shield with either Expertise/toughness/cleave (improved knockdown is not that useful, as at highest levels I could knockdown (with the Bard.Fi.RDD) also elite fire giants and drow weapon masters and priestess): I am tempted to avoid taking expertise in favour of cleave, or toughness as with it and a +4 CON item this build would reach 500 HP.
Craft wand, instead of still spell, will help a lot, so I will be uncertain til the last minute on which metamagic feat to consider.

An earlier level of bard also helps a lot taking an earlier lasting inspiration --> if the bard song lasts more, there will be more uses of curse song, which means obtainging +7 AC/AB boost more times. Also, having CHA items helps singing a lv17 song, which means also +6 to skills that can allow her to open lock/search easily.
Blackguard would help a lot, but I am not so tempted by Evil itself (well, maybe in the future 😬), even if I can understand the (many) benefits of taking 4 levels (bard26.BG4.RDD10).

Here you can find the updated build. I will need to playtest it, now I am really busy with work so things will get a bit slow.
Orion, I will send you a PM for team session, I think I need to relevel it from scratch before having some team up adventures ;)

For cleric rules on WoG, I will post a clarification request so I can understand if rules for divine classes apply also to 1 cleric level.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content: The rules on WoG also apply to 1 level Clerics; they apply to all Clerics, regardless of level as the power(s) come from a Deity, not from the Cleric in question.

posts.author: Aquarius 233
posts.content:
Thanks Web!
So I have to choose among healing and animal domain, on the basis of which of them is useful at higher levels.
It seems that healing would be the best choice, given that bard summom spells (lv 7 max) are not useful at epic spells. What do you think?

It seems that brain work after having come back from work late is not to be done, as I looked that 17 CHA at lv 40.
Not taking Divine shield would also hinder the originality of the build, and I wonder if it is correct to use two slots for gear to only use DM (considering also the fact that it does not have expertise, and will mostly use a two-hand weapon). I think I will re-take divine shield.

If I want back the CHA to 18, the only paths are: swap two great strenght feats for great charisma + epic prowess, or revert back the abilities. As the build has sufficient strenght, the first solution is more practicable.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Yeah, in your build...if it is for WoG, I would still take Animal Domain.

Because you have UMD.  That means you can cast Summons IX from a scroll or item.

The Animal Domain will still affect it!  So you will get an Elemental Prince instead of Eldar Elemental (which is a big deal on WoG).

Not to mention *cough* sequencers...

posts.author: Aquarius 233
posts.content:
Sequencers! If I cast the summon ix scroll on it, and obtain a princess, buffable at least with haste and song.....omg! +9 AC

I haven' thought about them, and I already have a lv 20 halfling cleric of Ehlonna...I used the dweomerstone for backup heals, but it considering your suggestion.....

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
You cannot cast from items into a sequencer on WoG.

That said, perhaps a friendly caster might do it...

posts.author: Aquarius 233
posts.content:
Ah thank you for the clarification!
It's nice to always learn something in this forum, and in WoG. Helps with rising passion!

This should be the final build: I'll let you know, for now thank you all for the help!

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content: I like it!

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Here is a divine damage dealing teammate I have designed to team up with Aquarius on WoG!

He's got the cleric domains of trickery for lots of undispellable improved invisibility casts, and the law domain (custom) which has the spell lesser mind blank to make sure the divine spear doesn't falter and strikes true!

He borrows from Web's Smooth Archer concept by taking WS/EWS to boost up damage.

He's also a 'friendly caster' in case he needs some spells stored on a sequencer... that being said he is concealing his true nature (ie alignment) to the noble champion of Kord until later in the piece... juicy RP content incoming... ). A single level of 20% exp penalty at level 20.

The Divine Archer of Tiamat
SpoilerCleric(32), Fighter(4), Rogue(4), Human STR: 13 CON: 8 INT: 14 01: Rogue(1): Toughness, Point Blank Shot 03: Cleric(1): Rapid Shot, Trickery, Law 05: Cleric(3) 07: Rogue(2): {Evasion} 09: Cleric(6): Weapon Focus: Longbow 11: Cleric(8) 13: Cleric(10) 15: Cleric(12): Extend Spell 17: Cleric(14) 19: Cleric(16) 21: Fighter(2): Epic Prowess, Epic Weapon Focus: Longbow 23: Fighter(3) 25: Cleric(18) 27: Cleric(20): Power Attack 29: Cleric(22) 31: Cleric(24) 33: Cleric(26): Great Charisma I, Great Wisdom II, (WIS=24), (CHA=16) 35: Cleric(28) 37: Rogue(4) 39: Cleric(31): Great Wisdom IV, (WIS=26) Skillpoints: 257 Saving Throw bonuses: Spells: +2 AB (max, naked): 27 (melee), 38 (ranged) Spell Casting: Cleric(9) 01: Disable Trap(4), Listen(4), Open Lock(4), Search(4), Set Trap(4), Tumble(4), UMD(3), Save(17),  03: Concentration(1), Spellcraft(3), Save(18),  05: Concentration(1), Save(26),  07: Disable Trap(6), Listen(6), Open Lock(6), Search(6), Set Trap(4), Tumble(6), UMD(7),  09: Save(9),  11: Save(19),  13: Save(29),  15: Save(39),  17: Save(49),  19: Save(59),  21: Concentration(5),  23: Concentration(4), Save(1),  25: Save(11),  27: Save(21),  29: Save(31),  31: Save(41),  33: Save(51),  35: Save(61),  37: Disable Trap(17), Listen(17), Open Lock(17), Tumble(20), UMD(6),  39: Concentration(5),

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Perhaps Assassin 2 instead of Rogue 4?

That would give you 2 more levels of either Fighter or Cleric (or 1 of both) AND no XP penalty.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content: Hey Web thanks for commenting, I initially thought as you did and tried assassin 2 (at 22 and 37)  but switched it because I wanted more skill points, cross classing 8 ranks each of hide and move silently hurt! Plus Rogue gets Evasion which is pretty sweet, and a bunch of rogueish skills early on which complements Aquarius's build. The single level of 20% exp penalty at level 20 is pretty minimal

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Some playtesting in a party...
Here's a series of screenshots from Aquarius, myself and a friend (Franz) partying together on World of Greyhawk Persistent World Server (WoG) over the last month playtesting Aquarius's new build.

For those familiar with WoG, we have done the following quests as a team: 
Borderkeep ('3 heads'), 
Kero's quest, 
Princeling's Boots quest, 
Necromancer quest, 
Temple of Elemental Evil, 
Manscorpion King
Tomb of Shattados
Dragon Cult/Dino Island, 
Hill Giants/Frost Giants/Fire Giants

And made a pitstop visit to Rift Canyon to visit Dragotha and Maggris.

We are around lvl 28 now. 

Betha (@Aquarius 233 ) -> human Bard/Cleric RDD, spear wielder with divine damage from divine might
Fifur (Franz @zg1k ) -> Fighter/Rogue/DD, warhammer and shield
Rold (me) -> human Cleric/Fighter/Rogue, zen archer with divine damage from divine might

Yogmister7 joined us briefly for Rift Canyon and a little of early Dragon Cult quest.

Valar (@Yogmister7 ) -> elven greatsword Fighter/Rogue/Weapon Master 

Notable bosses defeated:
Zuggtmoy - Demoness of Fungi, ToEE
Hill Giant Chief
Frost Giant Jarl
Fire Giant King Snurre
Drow Priestess Eclavdra 
Tharma-Nestra the Reptile God
Gargantuan Green Dragon Emeraxis
Maggris - Demigod of Spiders
Dragotha - Dracolich of Rift Canyon

Temple of Elemental Evil



Hill giants, Dragon Cult quest



Undermountain, Critwall Swamp and Rift Canyon

And the last screenshot deservedly belongs to Aquarius 233... who took this gem...

Chicken versus spider


Edit: forgot to add Tharma-Nestra the Reptile God to notable bosses defeated.

Betha and party in the Demonweb Pits

Some solid epic level content right here!
